titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Walter and Martha Leuba Papers, 1735-1988 SC.1988.01
titlestmt.author: Nancy Cushing and Alice Doolittle.

note.p: two bound scrapbook volumes of correspondence (Mildred Leuba) and other materials digitized and online Mar. 2013

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2021-06-11 09:40:55 -0400.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

did.abstract: Walter and Martha Leuba collected books, woodblock prints, and signed letters of writers, artists, and other notable figures. Walter Leuba was a prolific writer of poetry and prose, with a focus on literature and music. The papers in this collection document the Leubas' collecting activities, Walter's writing projects, and the Leubas' lives.

userestrict.head: Copyright
userestrict.p: The University of Pittsburgh holds the property rights to the material in this collection, but the copyright may still be held by the original creator/author. Researchers are therefore advised to follow the regulations set forth in the U.S. Copyright Code when publishing, quoting, or reproducing material from this collection without the consent of the creator/author or that go beyond what is allowed by fair use.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Preliminary efforts in processing this collection was by Charles Aston and Ashley Brandolph. Revised and completed in 2011 by Nancy Cushing and Alice Doolittle.

odd.head: Previous Citation
odd.p: Walter and Martha Leuba Papers, 1735-1988, SC.1988.01, Special Collections Department, University of Pittsburgh

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Walter and Martha Leuba Papers, 1735-1988, SC.1988.01, Archives & Special Collections, University of Pittsburgh Library System

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Walter and Martha Leuba Book and Print Collection. See Special Collections for inventory of prints. All monographs are cataloged in PittCat, the library's online catalog.

bioghist.head: Biography
bioghist.p: Walter Leuba (1902-1983) and Martha Leuba (nee Dryburgh) (1909-1988) collected books, wood block prints, other art, and signed letters by writers, artists, and other notable figures. They were married in 1938 and lived for much of their lives at 516 Jacksonia Street on Pittsburgh's North Side. Walter's collecting activities began in the 1920's, around the time that he met his first wife, Mildred Wallach (1908-1932).

Walter Leuba spent his early life in New York, Rhode Island, and Pittsburgh. After high school, Leuba attended Carnegie Institute of Technology (now Carnegie Mellon University), where he studied fine art, English, and history. Through Porter Garnett, founder of the Laboratory Press at C.I.T., Leuba developed his love of finely printed and illustrated books.

Leuba left C.I.T. in 1923 for financial reasons and moved to New York. While there, he wrote poetry under the name Paul Sandoz and published his first book of verse,Legend, in 1925. After a year in Europe, Leuba returned to Pittsburgh in 1926. He married Mildred Wallach in 1927. Their son, Julian Christopher Leuba, nicknamed "Beppo," was born in 1929. In 1932, Leuba was laid off and the family lived on Mildred's wages until her death in December 1932, following a brief and sudden illness. In early 1933, Leuba left his son in the care of his paternal aunts in California. When Leuba brought his son back to Pittsburgh two years later, a succession of friends, relatives, and a children's home cared for Christopher until Leuba married Martha Dryburgh. In 1934, Leuba began working as a caseworker at the Allegheny County Board of Assistance. He earned a B.A. and an M.A. in social work from the University of Pittsburgh in 1947.

Leuba was a prolific writer of poetry and prose. He wrote frequent letters to the editors of theTimes Literary Supplement and Pittsburgh newspapers, and contributed to literary journals andThe Pittsburgh Point. In 1947, Macmillan published Leuba'sPoems out of a Hat. In 1967 hisGeorge Saintsbury was published in the Twayne Men of Letters series. His books of poetryNo Other Mirror and Quips and Cranks, the prose-poemCrusade, andTwo Essays on Bach were privately printed. Leuba also produced a number of books through collaborative efforts. In 1947, his correspondence with Ernest Nevin Dilworth about modern education was published by Macmillan asSmith Unbound and received considerable critical notice. Leuba and Dilworth collaborated again onTwo Dialogues: Norman Douglas and George Santayana in 1974. With Robert McCullough, Leuba wrote and took photos forThe Pennsylvania Main Line Canal (1973). In addition, Leuba contributed poems to a collection of Norton Peterson woodcuts and text to a George Nama portfolio,Monument Studies.

Beginning in the 1970s, the Leubas began donating books and prints from their collection to the University Library System (ULS) of the University of Pittsburgh. After Martha Leuba's death in 1988, their remaining prints, books, and papers were transferred to the ULS Special Collections Department.

For a more detailed biography of Walter Leuba, please contact the ULS Special Collections Department at the University of Pittsburgh. Additional biographical material is collected in Series V, Personal Papers: Subseries 2, Biography and Genealogy.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: The Walter and Martha Leuba Papers contain materials related to the Leubas' collecting and writing pursuits, including manuscripts, research notes, clippings, the Leuba's collection of autograph and typescript signed letters, catalogs and indexes of their collections, and wood blocks. They reflect the Leubas' interests in books, art, literature, and music. In addition, the collection contains materials related to the Leubas' lives, family, friends, and other interests; these include correspondence, photographs, scrapbooks, diaries, and personal papers.

The bulk of the material in the collection dates from within the Leubas' lifetimes, 1902 to 1988. Material from before 1902 is primarily from their collection of signed letters (Series III, ALS and TLS) and family records (Series V, Personal Papers). Some of the material, particularly in Series V, Personal Papers, pertains to Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, where the Leubas spent most of their adult lives; a small portion pertains to New York City, where Walter Leuba lived briefly.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is organized into nine series:

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: Series contains drafts, typscripts and manuscripts by Leuba and others. Some folders include materials found with manuscripts, such as notes, clippings, correspondence, and photographs. Series is divided into two subseries: Subseries 1, Manuscripts by Walter Leuba, and Subseries 2, Manuscripts by Other Authors. Materials are arranged alphabetically by title and author. Larger, legal size materials have been separated for storage purposes and are listed at the end of this Series.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains manuscripts of works written by or in collaboration with Walter Leuba, including Leuba's compilations and transcriptions of works by others. Leuba wrote broadly on his many interests; principal subjects are literature, British literary figures (e.g., George Saintsbury), and classical music (e.g., the works of J.S. Bach). He also wrote extensive poetry.

The material in this series includes manuscripts and typescripts, as well as clippings of published letters and poetry. Folders are arranged alphabetically by manuscript title or, if untitled, by primary subject. Also included are folders of research and reading notes, clippings, correspondence, and other materials that relate to a specific manuscript or subject; these folders are filed with their associated manuscript or, if no manuscript exists, by their primary subject. Additional research and reading notes are in Series IV, Inventories and Notes; the notes in Series IV are not associated with a specific subject or known manuscript, or are related to multiple subjects or manuscripts.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains manuscripts and typescripts of works by writers other than Walter Leuba. Authors include family members (Christopher, Martha, and Mildred Leuba), colleagues and friends (e.g., Robert McCullough), and other individuals. Individual manuscripts are filed separately, with folders arranged alphabetically by name of author and then by title of manuscript, or by primary subject if untitled. Some folders also contain correspondence, notes, photographs, and other materials found with the manuscript. Larger materials have been separated for storage purposes and are listed at the end of this subseries.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: Series contains correspondence between Leuba and a range of personal and professional contacts. Series has been arranged into 4 subseries: (1) Personal Correspondence, (2) Professional Correspondence, (3) Correspondence with Mildred and (4)Correspondence from Walter Leuba. An address book listing Leuba contacts is found at the beginning of Subseries 1 (Personal Correspondence). Except where noted, correspondence is grouped alphabetically by last name or corporate name. The bulk of the letters are addressed to either Walter Leuba; some letters are addressed to Paul Sandoz (Walter Leuba's pen-name), Mildred Leuba, Martha Leuba, and Christopher Leuba (aka Beppo). Correspondents are listed with their spouses when appropriate.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: Subseries contains correspondence between Leuba and colleagues, friends, and family. An address book listing Leuba contacts is fund at the beginning of this subseries. Correspondence is arranged alphabetically by last name, where available.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: Subseries contains correspondence between Leuba and various editors, publishers, and organizations. Correspondence is grouped alphabetically by last name or corporate name.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: Subseries consists of two bound scrapbook volumes of correspondence and other materials. Volume I primarily consists of handwritten letters, photographs, original poetry, and other material, such as telegrams, hotel receipts, and other miscellaneous items. Volume II also contains correspondence from and about Mildred, including a considerable correspondence with Eli Siegel. Both volumes are digitized and presented online in this finding aid.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: Subseries consists of correspondence written by Walter Leuba to various recipients. The letters are arranged chronologically with undated items at the end.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: Series consists of Leuba's collection of Autograph and Typescript Letters, Signed (ALS and TLS) from notable writers, artists, and other public figures. Series includes items dating from 1735 to 1986, although many items are undated. Series is divided into 3 subseries: (1) Letters by Book Illustrators and Printers; (2) Letters by Writers; and (3) Letters by Others. Leuba's lists of items within his collection are included at the beginning of subseries 1 and 2. These lists include many, though not all of the items in this series.

did.unittitle: Letters by Book Illustrators and Printers

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: Subseries contains Leuba's collection of Autograph and Typescript Letters, Signed (ALS and TLS), from 1818 to 1986. Letters are addressed to various recipients, including some to Walter Leuba. A list in Leuba's hand, "Letters, ALS and TLS, of book illustrators and printers" appears at the beginning of the subseries and lists many, though not all, of the ALS and TLS in the subseries.

did.unittitle: Letters, ALS and TLS, of book illustrators & printers (list)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: Subseries contains Leuba's collection of Autograph and Typescript Letters, Signed (ALS and TLS) from 1735 to 1974. Letters are addressed to various people, including some to Walter Leuba. Bulk are in English; some French. A list in Leuba's hand, "Letters of Writers" appears at the beginning of the subseries and lists many, though not all of the ALS and TLS in the subseries.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: Subseries contains Leuba's collection of Autograph and Typed Letters, Signed (ALS and TLS) from historical and political figures, as well as letters with illegible signatures or unknown profession. Most letters are undated, but range from circa 1804 to 1978. Letters include examples from a Crimean War correspondent, British nobility, and a small group of materials by and about British naturalists, among others. In addition to signed letters, subseries 3 also contains related materials, such as a signed 1807 promissory note between radical publisher and MP, William Cobbett, and Richard Bagshaw. Also, includes one folder of facsimile plates of letters and other items related to Robert Burns, Admiral Rodney, and Sir Nicholas and Nathaniel Bacon.

did.unittitle: Balfour, Arthur James Balfour, Earl of
Blessington, [Marguerite, Countess of], to Captain Marryat
British Naturalists - Asa Gray, Roger Lispey, and Alfred Wallace
Promissory note – W[illia]m Cobbett to Rich[ard] Bagshaw, Newsman
Facsimiles of 18th century manuscript materials - Sir Nicholas and Sir Nathaniel Bacon; Robert Burns; and Admiral Rodney

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: Series contains notes and inventories related to a variety of subjects and in a variety of formats, including typed and handwritten reading notes, bound journals listing books read, notes and register pages related to Leuba exhibits, and thematic groups of index cards or notecards (e.g. grouped by Leuba by author or artist, lists of first names, and other topics.) Names or subject terms are provided from the first and last pages of binders and noteboxes, where available. Binder pages have been left in the order in which they were bindered, boxed, or fastened (some fastenings have been removed for preservation purposes). Bulk of material is undated, dates are listed where available. Oversize materials have been separated for storage purposes and are listed at the end of this Series.

scopecontent.p: Folder contents includes poem by Wilder Bentley, 1972.

did.unittitle: Case File Notes, Transcriptions, and Correspondence
Oversize prints, sketches, clippings, notes, Bach score

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: Series contains personal papers related to Walter and Martha Leuba, including diary pages, genealogy notes, diplomas, and certificates. Series is arranged into 3 subseries: (1) Diaries and Journals, (2) Biography and Genealogy, and (3) Official Documents. Subseries 3 contains oversize materials; oversize items were separated for storage purposes and are listed at the end of the subseries. Leuba's personal papers, especially diary and journal pages, often refer to his book collecting and research activities; for related material, see also Leuba's reading notes in Series IV (Inventories and Notes).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: Subseries consists of personal diary and journals by Walter Leuba, as well as some journal material for Martha Leuba. Includes wall and appointment calendars with detailed personal entries, especially between 1984-1987. Entries describe family life, social work, reflections on prints and literature, and major events such as WWII or the Kennedy assassination. Folders are arranged chronologically; undated materials are found at the end of the subseries.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: Subseries includes material collected by Walter Leuba from and about family members. Includes biographical material written by Leuba and others. Also includes genealogy materials, such as birth and marriage certificates from family members, as well as war ration books and passenger lists from 1926 transatlantic crossing and other materials.

did.unittitle: Family Records and Genealogy, Notes, and Correspondence
Oral Interview with Walter Leuba by Lawrence Howard

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: Subseries contains a range of medical, financial, and professional documents related to Walter, Martha, and Mildred Leuba, including birth, marriage, and death certificates. Additional vital records related to members of the extended Leuba family were collected by Leuba in separate genealogy files and can be found in Subseries 2 (Biography and Genealogy). Oversize items have been separated for storage purposes and are listed at the end of this Subseries.

did.unittitle: Department of Public Assistance Certificates - Martha Leuba

Oversize - Martha Dryburgh, B.S. diploma, University of Pittsburgh

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: Series consists of albums, loose, and framed photos. Albums cover a range of subjects, including groups of family photos and albums documenting places and homes (516 Jacksonia in particular). Bulk of the materials are undated; dates are provided where available. Oversize items have been separated for storage purposes and are listed at the end of this Series.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: Series includes bound scrapbook volumes and loose scrapbook pages, circa 1918 - 1980 (bulk undated). The bulk of the material consists of newspaper clippings about literary topics. Loose clippings are inserted between the covers and pages of most scrapbooks. Other pages include collections of dried leaves, photographs, and concert programs, and other items. Oversize items have been separated for storage purposes and are listed at the end of this series. Additional scrapbook volumes of correspondence can be found in Series II, Subseries 3 (Correspondence with Mildred Leuba).

did.unittitle: Bound Literary Clippings - Austen, Johnston and others

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: Includes m.s. and published poems by Walter Leuba

did.unittitle: Bound Art, Woodcut and Book Plates Scrapbook

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: Series contains clippings and printed matter related to Leuba's collecting activities, event programs, announcements, and other ephemera. Bulk of items are undated; dates are provided where available.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: Consists of 6 woodblocks and related items. Includes a linoleum block of Leuba's home (516 Jacksonia Street) and various other patterns.
